channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: A strip of road has been excavated across st George's place. Since it has been filled in, the tarmac has depressed. On one side more than the other. It has created a dip in the road for traffic moving in southerly direction onto st George's road. When a bus passes over the dip at speed i.e. when the traffic lights are green and the bus does not need to stop it thuds into the road making a noise. When a large heavy vehicle goes over the dip at speed a massive bang is felt in the building 27a St George's road. The bang is immense and the whole building feels like a car has driven into it. After the bang, the building violently shakes as if an earthquake is occuring. The council tell the public to let them know when a utility companys excavation and refill subsequently deteriorates but there is not an option here to choose. This is why I chose manhole damage. To be clear it is not a manhole., 11th August
item.description:
Fourway junction across royal well lane and st George's place. What3 words. Horses.jacket.desire. Not sure how long it's been occuring. I noticed it in the building approx 3 months ago and I was told it's been happening a while but no one can say when it started.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 2, Royal Well Lane, Montpellier, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: A long stretch of this busy road has broken up despite several attempts at patch repairs. This section should have been resurfaced in preference to Back Montpellier Street which sees very little traffic., 11th August
item.description:
From approaching Lidl as you leave Cheltenham until after the old railway bridge.

item.title: Deteriorating pavement degrading integrity of wall, 11th August
item.description:
Public pavement bordering garden wall of 143 Abbotswood Road - north of small damaged area already due to be improved. Total length requiring attention is 60 meters. Pavement deteriorating over a number of years. Children use footpath daily to and from nearby primary school.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Abbotswood Road, Brockworth, Tewkesbury
Report on FixMyStreet
item.category: Other damage to pavement i.e. cobbles, raised mound/surface

item.title: Barley growing across the path, 10th August
item.description:
The trodden path in the picture is not on the public footpath. It must be cleared to a width of at least one metre, running past the telegraph pole. It must be done before the crop is harvested. This is the Winchcombe Way, a popular route.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Rushley Lane, Winchcombe, Tewkesbury
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Overgrown vegetation at the entrance to the cart track going from the end of the Cold Slad road to the farm below., 10th August
item.description:
The start of the track by Journeys End. This track has been in continuous use by walkers for many years but doesn’t appear on your map as a Public Right of Way. Further down the same track the path crosses a stream and there is a Public Footpath sign visible but fence posts being put up suggest this access might be compromised. We’re not sure what the legal position is on access to this route being maintained.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Dog Lane, Badgeworth, Tewkesbury
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Tree blocking footpath and vegetation makes walking the path impossible without brandishing sticks to clear brambles, nettles and overhanging shrubs, 10th August
item.description:
The public footpath that joins the ‘u bend’ at the top of Dog Lane with the Cold Slad road (known locally as Jacobs Ladder). We did eventually fight our way through but with great difficulty.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): A417 Missing Link, Badgeworth, Tewkesbury
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Overgrown trees, 10th August
item.description:
On Land adjacent to 15 Golden Miller Road, GL50 4RD, these two sycamore trees are grossly overgrown, I am concerned to potential damage to my property, and would like some essential maintenance done to make the trees less of a nuisance to my drains & rain water gutters. The height is excessive and would like them pruned so that I can have solar panels installed to my roof, to use green energy. The trees are in excess of 35ft tall. Every winter they also deposit massive amounts of seeds that cause drain blockages and slippery pavements. Please help.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 15, Golden Miller Road, Wymans Brook, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Whole pavement in this area needs redoing as damaged/ broken. An elderly person fell on it last week!!, 10th August
item.description:
Hedge outside 19 Greenhills road. Pavement is regularily used by elderly people and people with pushchairs. It si so broken someone tripped on it last week and got badly hurt hence needs attention ASAP

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 19, Greenhills Road, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Repeat problem of more tarmac needed to level path, 10th August
item.description:
See photos on how the weeds are growing g up from the cracked tarmac. This is casing a ' hedge' on the curb side of the path next to the road. It is proving a hazard to walkers, joggers a d cyclists. I think now is the season to get this work underway please. Location is Up Hatherley Way next to lamp number 22.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Up Hatherley Way, Hatherley, Cheltenham

item.title: Possible sinkhole reappearing on Leckhampton Road, 10th August
item.description:
160 Leckhampton Road GL53 0DH Large sinkhole that has been repaired previously. This is sinking again and road surface has now also cracked. High volumes of traffic on this road and potentially a serious safety hazard .
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 160, Leckhampton Road, Leckhampton, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet
